text: - Scale Factory was founded in 2009.
We're based in London in the UK,

and it's our mission to
be the go-to AWS partner
for SaaS in the world.

We worked with a number of
SaaS businesses over the years
across a range of business sectors,

including some of the security
and compliant industries
like Fintech, such as Caplin,
but also in pharmaceuticals, MedTech,
and other industries as well.

We decided to join the
SaaS competency program
in order to differentiate ourselves,
and we recognize that in the market today,
SaaS is a real growing opportunity.

- So I'm Steve South, I'm
the CTO here at Caplin.

Caplin really helped to
pioneer realtime web streaming
in the early days of the 2000s.

We also have a real focus
on designing and delivering

user centered trading
applications for our clients,
who are mainly banks.

So when delivering trading
platforms for banks,
time to market is a key challenge.
So being able to then scale,

being able to set up additional
pre-production environments,
it's not easy.
So we really wanted an end-to-end workflow
for our development team.
We wanted infrastructure as code,

wanted deployment to go right
through from our agile sprints
into production really, really simply.
And that is a challenge.

We had Scale Factory come
in and help us to avoid
some of those challenges.
Bringing their knowledge

I think really helped to
accelerate our first delivery

and make sure the bar
was really, really high.

- Being a SaaS competency
partner has benefits
for both ourselves and for the customers.
For the customers that we work with,

it's easy for them now to find
us as a partner to work with.

There are also funding
benefits that we have access to
through our program membership

that can take some of
the cost and the risk
out of building a SaaS platform on AWS.

Through our relationship
with SaaS Factory team

at AWS, we have access to
an entire team of people
at AWS who are themselves focused
on the SaaS end of the market,
both in terms of business development
and solutions architecture expertise.

I believe the SaaS Lens
for Well-Architected
and the SaaS Insights Hub really help us

when we're delivering projects
for customers like Caplin,

because they give us access
to knowledge and expertise

based on what AWS themselves
have seen in the field.

- I'm really excited with
our SaaS platform now,

how we can support our
clients in the future.

We can support with a
reduced time to market,

and we can really provide
flexibility in their deployment.

But I'm really excited about
how we can take that forward

in future, how we can scale
for a production environments,
how we can increase the number
of pre-production environments
to support more efficient development,
which will support high quality delivery.

So it's really the full
life cycle of a project,

which is really going to
change when we are deploying
to the cloud based on the platform
that we've developed here.
